title: Constituent Assembly Elections
summary: Members of the Constituent Assembly were elected through provincial elections under the Cabinet Mission Plan.
fullText: The Constituent Assembly of India was formed in 1946 after provincial elections. It represented diverse regions and communities, beginning the historic task of drafting the Constitution.

questions.q: In which year was the Constituent Assembly elected?

title: First Meeting of the Assembly
summary: The first meeting took place with Dr. Sachchidananda Sinha as interim President.
fullText: On 9 December 1946 the Assembly met for the first time. Dr. Sachchidananda Sinha served as interim President until a permanent President was elected.

questions.q: Who was interim President of the Constituent Assembly?

title: Permanent President Elected
summary: Dr. Rajendra Prasad was elected the permanent President of the Assembly.
fullText: On 11 December 1946, Dr. Rajendra Prasad was chosen as permanent President, presiding over subsequent sessions with dignity and consensus-building.

questions.q: Who became the permanent President of the Assembly?

title: Objectives Resolution
summary: Jawaharlal Nehru moved the Objectives Resolution, guiding the Constitution's philosophy.
fullText: Jawaharlal Nehru presented the Objectives Resolution outlining core values—sovereignty, democracy, justice, equality—which later influenced the Preamble.

title: Drafting Committee Formed
summary: A Drafting Committee chaired by Dr. B.R. Ambedkar was formed to prepare the draft.
fullText: On 29 August 1947, the Drafting Committee under Dr. B.R. Ambedkar began shaping the draft Constitution with meticulous legal and comparative study.

title: First Draft Submitted
summary: The first draft was presented, initiating debates and public feedback.
fullText: The first draft released in November 1947 opened avenues for robust debates, expert inputs, and public reactions, refining constitutional design.

questions.q: What followed the first draft submission?

title: Debates & Amendments
summary: Clause-by-clause debates and amendments built consensus.
fullText: Through 1948–49, the Assembly deliberated on clauses, moved amendments, and balanced diverse views to reach a widely acceptable text.

title: Adoption of Constitution
summary: The Constitution was adopted; 26 Nov is Constitution Day.
fullText: On 26 November 1949, the Assembly adopted the Constitution of India, marking a historic milestone and setting the date for partial enforcement.

title: Signing the Constitution
summary: Members signed the Constitution in Hindi and English.
fullText: On 24 January 1950, members signed the Constitution in Hindi and English, sealing India’s guiding charter before full enforcement.

questions.q: In how many languages was it signed?

title: Constitution in Effect (Republic Day)
summary: The Constitution came into force; India became a Republic.
fullText: On 26 January 1950, the Constitution fully came into effect. India became a Republic with the President as head of State.
